blog.name: tinyvampire
blog.title: 𝔈𝔪𝔬 𝔗𝔥𝔬𝔱 𝔅𝔬𝔶™
blog.description:
こんにちは !

I’m Mitchell, but u can call me Mitch & I use he/him pronouns! I’m 21 years old, a trans dude, and gay af (and single!! hello boys c:). I love makeup, art, horror, fashion, music, gaming, and old stuff (especially abandoned buildings *-*). I’m a (very new) furry, too. My hobbies include snuggling my loud cat son Jack, falling back into the fnaf fandom hardcore once every year, accidentally playing Sims 4 for six hours, and bingeing entire seasons of RuPaul’s Drag Race until my fear of losing my Animal Crossing villagers causes me to run to my 3DS and curse the eternal debt I’ve accrued via satan who is the devil, Tom Nook.

Just so you know - I’ve been diagnosed with major depression, general anxiety, & OCD and I sometimes talk about those things on my blog as a way to cope and share my personal mental health journey/experiences, as I’m now in therapy & working with my therapist to heal. If reading stuff like that doesn’t sound like your cup of tea or if, like me, you get panicky reading about that kind of stuff, I always tag those posts with whatever mental illness I’m talking about, so feel free to block those tags! And if you’d like me to add any tags, I absolutely will! Just let me know. ^-^

blog.name: thedemonphanti
blog.title: thedemonphanti
blog.description: Treat People With Respect | Unpopular Opinions Welcome

summary: Angelika Oles isn't very nice. other commentary youtubers said that she tends to be unnecessarily mean in her videos. I think...
question: Angelika Oles isn't very nice. other commentary youtubers said that she tends to be unnecessarily mean in her videos. I think she's a clout chaser, her critique is usually not constructive. she could have been harsher to Dan and Phil like she was to Lilly Singh, but realistically what can she even say about them? they're basically controversy-free, other commentary youtubers have respect for them. so she just made that video to state that their numbers are dropping and to call them irrelevant.
answer:
she doesn’t even know why exactly it’s happening and can’t offer good advice since she’s a newbie who makes videos slagging other people off. and in her comment section she was “hearting” comments of people calling Dan and Phil queerbaiters and how they need to just say whether they’re a couple or not. lol

———

I had never heard of or watched her other than that one video, so I don’t know the backstory, but I didn’t even get the impression that she thought Dan and Phil were irrelevant. “Road to Irrelevance” is just the name of her series. What I got from her commentary was that her impression was that the fact that they weren’t uploading because they were on tour was what was causing their channels to not do as well as they could be doing statistically. I agree that nothing she said was really constructive, but, not being familiar with her, I couldn’t tell if that was because she was holding back or that wasn’t part of the series. To be honest, like I said originally (or at least meant to say), I found the comments to be the most interesting.

I am really glad you sent this ask though because when you mentioned Lilly Singh, I went and looked up the video in question and I had seen that video of Lilly going on about how much bigger than YouTube she was before, but never had any context. I cannot believe it was in response to a video on this channel. Why on earth did she think responding to that video was a good idea? To be completely honest, it was one of the nicer commentaries on Lilly Singh I have seen. I’ve seen Jenna Marbles be more critical of her! That struck me as very childish and self-defeating, especially since I have never watched Lilly or Angelika, but had seen that footage in other videos and ended up with a pretty negative opinion of Lilly.

Anyway, back to Dan and Phil. I did notice that she was “hearting” almost all of the comments. I thought that was something she must do to acknowledge everyone commenting on her videos, but again, I don’t know. I read a lot of the comments and I did see several of them mention queerbaiting and I have said on this blog before, I don’t think Dan and Phil do that. If I’m being honest, there was a time when I did, and it did make me lose some respect for Dan, but that was before I understood the concept and why it can’t be applied to real people and their interpersonal relationships. I think the fact that I was misinformed at one point is one of the reasons that it makes me so angry when people use the accusation of “queerbaiting” as a threat to try to control Dan and Phil and try to enforce their headcanon, because it literally has the potential to harm their reputations. So on that topic, I definitely agree with you that accusations like that are big things that you should think about before you put out into the universe. I definitely thought there were a lot of comments that brought up really good or interesting points though as well.

blog.name: phanfictioncatalogue
blog.title: phanfiction catalogue
blog.description:
mobile users, click here!

please refer to our FAQ first.

Our goal is to create an alphabetized library of every phanfiction in the phandom. Besides that, we compile masterlists of different genres that are scheduled for posting every few days, and help find fics that have been mislocated.

title: Soulmate AUs (Count Downs) Masterlist
body:
Countdown to Him (ao3) - Dilia_Howlter

Summary: “If there was a timer that counted down to the day you met your soulmate, would you want to know?” In a world where everyone has a clock on their wrist that counted down until the day they met their soulmate, Dan and Phil’s soulmate counters both hit Zero as soon as their eyes met except for one thing… Only Dan knows this.

My Genius Soulmate (wattpad) -  Saymynametracob

Summary: If numbers on your wrist controlled one of the most important aspects of your life, how would you feel? For Dan Howell, absolute genius, this is a thing that causes much stress and discomfort to him.  Dan likes to know how things work and this is something that he has tried and failed many times to understand. Phil Lester, also a well known and praised genius, hasn’t given much thought to the clock on his wrist. He doesn’t see the point in worrying over something that he can’t change. When these two worlds collide many questions will be answered. Many things will be discovered and many things will be built.

One Second Closer - goldenrose95

Summary: Soulmate AU where you’re born with a timer on your wrist that counts down to the moment you meet your soulmate. Except there’s one other case when the numbers reach zero, and Phil doesn’t find out until he’s too late. Almost.

Out Of Time (ao3) - DarkEyedDreamer

Summary: Dan is watching in horror as his timer goes down. He’s meant to meet his soulmate in less than a few minutes. He should be excited, but in this zombie ridden world his soulmate is probably long dead.

Quixotic (ao3) - lastphanhope

Summary: Phil was always told his soulmate would be a beautiful girl with shiny hair and a good sense of humour. It’s not, his soulmate is Dan Howell, who’s got too many walls that Phil’s determined to break down, falling in love with him just happens in the process.

Soulfinders (ao3) - JulienneJc

Summary: In an Alternate Universe when we where born, we have a clock implanted on our wrist, counting down to the day we meet our soulmate.

Soulmate Seeker - littlellamalittlelion

Summary: Dan and Phil were born in a world where you get a little pocket watch when you are born, that will help you find the love of your life. The clock ticks backwards from the moment your soulmate is born (or you are born if your soulmate is older than you) until you cross your soulmate on the streets, and then it starts ticking clockwise. Once your clock is working you have 48 hours to find your soulmate and start a relationship of any kind, or you are going to loose them forever. Every year in your birthday you get a glimpse of your soulmate during your dreams, as a way to give hints of where they could be, and as you get older, the dreams get more colorful, vivid and clear. Dan wakes up after a night out with his college friends, not remembering anything from the night before, and with his clock working clockwise. Now he has to find anyone and everyone that was in that party with him, to get to his soulmate before they loose their bond forever.

Soul Mate Timer (wattpad) - littlepinkllama

Summary: Everybody is born with a small timer on their wrist that counts down till they meet their soul mate. Dan Howell however was born without his…

Take Your Breath Away - full-dark-no-starss

Summary: Phil has been waiting for his soul-mate ever since the numbers appeared on his arm a year ago. Though it’s funny, unlike his friends where their soul-mates are destined for them in thirty or forty years, his is just six hours away. Then there’s Dan Howell, the boy he sits next to in class. And one day, six hours before Phil is supposed to meet his soul mate, Dan surprises him with a question.

“Why is yours so close?”

Which begs the question: is the clock counting down to a soul-mate or something else?

The Path to Heaven - nagirci

Summary: If a clock could count down to the moment you meet your soulmate, would you want to know?

The Swing at the End of the World - uhnonniemiss

Summary: AU where humans are given a watch at birth that shows you how much time you have left before you die. The year is 2025, and Phil’s watch has ticked down to his final day, so Dan helps him carry out his last wish. Warnings: Character death, mentions of cancer.

Tick Tock Tick Tock - yuurisnice

Summary: Phil’s clock starts and he wants nothing more than for the soulmate to be Dan. 2009!Phan

Together, We Will Rule - pasteldanhowells

Summary: Phil is the prince and soon to be future king, and hasn’t found his soulmate yet. Everybody in the kingdom is on edge waiting to know who will be the future princess. But, plot twist, his soulmate happens to be Dan (aka a boy, and not a princess), and everybody is shocked because being gay isn’t accepted with most people in the kingdom. But, it’s not Phil’s fault his soulmate turned out to be a boy, so things have to change whether the kingdom likes it or not. He and everyone else in the kingdom have to get used to this new idea of there being two kings rather than a king and a queen.

When the Clock Strikes Twelve (ao3) - Willow_Angel

Summary: Phan AU. Dan is embarrassed by the time on his tattoo until he meets a handsome stranger at a party for the prince.

Zero - phanlight

Summary: Digits counting down to meet your soulmate.

reblog.comment:

The clock ticks backwards from the moment your soulmate is born (or you are born if your soulmate is older than you) until you cross your soulmate on the streets, and then it starts ticking clockwise. Once your clock is working you have 48 hours to find your soulmate and start a relationship of any kind, or you are going to loose them forever. Every year in your birthday you get a glimpse of your soulmate during your dreams, as a way to give hints of where they could be, and as you get older, the dreams get more colorful, vivid and clear. Dan wakes up after a night out with his college friends, not remembering anything from the night before, and with his clock working clockwise. Now he has to find anyone and everyone that was in that party with him, to get to his soulmate before they loose their bond forever.

Soul Mate Timer (wattpad) - littlepinkllama

Summary: Everybody is born with a small timer on their wrist that counts down till they meet their soul mate. Dan Howell however was born without his…

Take Your Breath Away - full-dark-no-starss

Summary: Phil has been waiting for his soul-mate ever since the numbers appeared on his arm a year ago. Though it’s funny, unlike his friends where their soul-mates are destined for them in thirty or forty years, his is just six hours away. Then there’s Dan Howell, the boy he sits next to in class. And one day, six hours before Phil is supposed to meet his soul mate, Dan surprises him with a question.

“Why is yours so close?”

Which begs the question: is the clock counting down to a soul-mate or something else?

The Path to Heaven - nagirci

Summary: If a clock could count down to the moment you meet your soulmate, would you want to know?

The Swing at the End of the World - uhnonniemiss

Summary: AU where humans are given a watch at birth that shows you how much time you have left before you die. The year is 2025, and Phil’s watch has ticked down to his final day, so Dan helps him carry out his last wish. Warnings: Character death, mentions of cancer.

Tick Tock Tick Tock - yuurisnice

Summary: Phil’s clock starts and he wants nothing more than for the soulmate to be Dan. 2009!Phan

Together, We Will Rule - pasteldanhowells

Summary: Phil is the prince and soon to be future king, and hasn’t found his soulmate yet. Everybody in the kingdom is on edge waiting to know who will be the future princess. But, plot twist, his soulmate happens to be Dan (aka a boy, and not a princess), and everybody is shocked because being gay isn’t accepted with most people in the kingdom. But, it’s not Phil’s fault his soulmate turned out to be a boy, so things have to change whether the kingdom likes it or not. He and everyone else in the kingdom have to get used to this new idea of there being two kings rather than a king and a queen.

When the Clock Strikes Twelve (ao3) - Willow_Angel

Summary: Phan AU. Dan is embarrassed by the time on his tattoo until he meets a handsome stranger at a party for the prince.

Zero - phanlight

Summary: Digits counting down to meet your soulmate.
trail.content:
Countdown to Him (ao3) - Dilia_Howlter

Summary: “If there was a timer that counted down to the day you met your soulmate, would you want to know?” In a world where everyone has a clock on their wrist that counted down until the day they met their soulmate, Dan and Phil’s soulmate counters both hit Zero as soon as their eyes met except for one thing… Only Dan knows this.

My Genius Soulmate (wattpad) -  Saymynametracob

Summary: If numbers on your wrist controlled one of the most important aspects of your life, how would you feel? For Dan Howell, absolute genius, this is a thing that causes much stress and discomfort to him.  Dan likes to know how things work and this is something that he has tried and failed many times to understand. Phil Lester, also a well known and praised genius, hasn’t given much thought to the clock on his wrist. He doesn’t see the point in worrying over something that he can’t change. When these two worlds collide many questions will be answered. Many things will be discovered and many things will be built.

One Second Closer - goldenrose95

Summary: Soulmate AU where you’re born with a timer on your wrist that counts down to the moment you meet your soulmate. Except there’s one other case when the numbers reach zero, and Phil doesn’t find out until he’s too late. Almost.

Out Of Time (ao3) - DarkEyedDreamer

Summary: Dan is watching in horror as his timer goes down. He’s meant to meet his soulmate in less than a few minutes. He should be excited, but in this zombie ridden world his soulmate is probably long dead.

Quixotic (ao3) - lastphanhope

Summary: Phil was always told his soulmate would be a beautiful girl with shiny hair and a good sense of humour. It’s not, his soulmate is Dan Howell, who’s got too many walls that Phil’s determined to break down, falling in love with him just happens in the process.

Soulfinders (ao3) - JulienneJc

Summary: In an Alternate Universe when we where born, we have a clock implanted on our wrist, counting down to the day we meet our soulmate.

Soulmate Seeker - littlellamalittlelion

Dan wakes up after a night out with his college friends, not remembering anything from the night before, and with his clock working clockwise. Now he has to find anyone and everyone that was in that party with him, to get to his soulmate before they loose their bond forever.
